action.action-desc: Mr. Hamadeh of Arizona (for himself and Mr. Begich) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of ranked choice voting in elections for Federal office.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Preventing Ranked Choice Corruption Act.

section.header: Prohibiting ranked choice voting in Federal elections

subsection.text: Title III of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 (52 U.S.C. 21081 et seq.), as amended by section 2(a) of the COCOA Act of 2024, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating sections 305 and 306 as sections 306 and 307; and
by inserting after section 304 the following new section:

section.header: Prohibiting ranked choice voting in Federal elections
section.text: A State may not carry out any election for Federal office using a system of ranked choice voting under which each voter ranks the candidates for the office in the order of the voter’s preference.

subsection.header: Conforming amendment relating to existing enforcement provisions
subsection.text: Section 401 of such Act (52 U.S.C. 21111) is amended by striking and 304 and inserting 304, and 305.
The table of contents of such Act is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating the items relating to sections 305 and 306 as relating to sections 306 and 307; and
by inserting after the item relating to section 304 the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 305. Prohibiting ranked choice voting in Federal elections.

subsection.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to elections held during 2026 or any succeeding year.
